alert.note: Alert for Coal; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 24 at 2:27AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Oklahoma, east central Oklahoma, southeast Oklahoma and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Cleveland, McClain and Pottawatomie. In east central Oklahoma, Pontotoc and Seminole. In southeast Oklahoma, Coal and Hughes. In southern Oklahoma, Garvin, Murray and Stephens. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional showers and thunderstorms are possible early this morning, which will aggravate existing flooding from recent storms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
